Reviews.Title: “Promised a lot but didn't deliver”
Reviews.Author: bfc2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with my partner over a weekend and experienced way to many small problems to be satisfied. We ordered breakfast for 7:30 and on the first morning it arrived at 7:50 (not a problem) but the second day it still hadn't arrived by 8:30 so we gave up and headed out for the day. We met the owner on the terrace, who was very apologetic, but the damage had already been done. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was the promise of free wifi but it wasn't working during our stay and the staff weren't especially helpful in getting it fixed or providing an alternative. I was counting on wifi access to get information on sights and restaurants so was frustrated when it wasn't available. There was a nespresso machine in the room, as advertised, but only four capsules were provided and they were not replenished. The hotel doesn't have a bar or restaurant so we had to go out for coffee. The front door of the hotel is locked and staff refused to provide us with an additional key. This meant that if we didn't go back to the hotel together I had to call my partner to be let into the hotel (up/down 3 flights of stairs). I was surprised that there was no "information booklet" in the room. I though the previous guest must have taken it but when I asked the staff they said that they don't provide such information. Given that there is no reception desk I would have appreciated information on how to contact the staff if needed. These are all relatively minor problems but the number of small problems certainly detracted from our stay. The staff were all friendly and the room very comfortable but for EUR240 per night I don't expect so many small problems. One of the staff (unfortunately I've forgotten her name but think it was Keti) was extremely helpful and gave us some excellent restaurant recommendations. She also appreciated the problems with the lack of wifi whereas the other staff just shrugged their shoulders and hoped I would go away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mom_of_s_n_y
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Moses Fountain Guest House, March 2012. We stayed at the "Swanky Cardinal" - the red room. A spacious beautifully designed room with a unique bathroom and a tiny terrace overlooking the busy junction below. The room is nice and lit, perfectly equipped, warm and pleasant. There's a free minibar they stock with light drinks and an espresso machine in the room. Breakfast was never the same in the 3 days we stayed there - but it always included a small bowl of fruit salad, another one of vegetables (no dressing, on the 3rd day we got olive oil), great cappuccino, toasts, croissants, and a bag with biscuits and crackers to take with us along the way. The shower is really big and uniquely designed. The hosts take big pride of it. As for the location: The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Termini station, which allows you to take the train to and from the airport instead of a taxi. There's a 2 minute walk from the hotel to the Republica metro station (the line goes to the Vatican). It's about 10 minutes to the Piazza Barberini, 15-20 minutes walk from the hotel to the Spanish Steps and about the same distance to the Piazza Venezia. Slightly longer walk to the Colosseum. During the day the area around the hotel is very busy. At night it's a lot quieter which makes it a good place to rest. However, if you're looking to stay in the middle of everything with a variety of restaurants right below - this is not it. We loved our stay at the Moses Fountain and may consider staying there again. But if you are not a walker - take into consideration there's a climb up the stairs to your room (no lift) and that at the end of a Rome walking day the last 10 minutes walk to the hotel through a relatively dormant area could be really exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: MitchellKW
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I have been traveling around the world practically every week for the last six months. We have each stayed in perhaps over two hundred hotels over our respective lifetimes. We can say, without hesitation, that the Moses Fountain Hotel, was the most wonderful hotel of all time. The hotel was like a sanctuary from the outside world. From the moment we arrived, we were warmly greeted by Emma and Jean who helped us with our luggage and made us feel right at home. The rooms were perfectly appointed with dramatic ceilings. The fridge was stocked with a nice variety of free beverages. The rooms were spotless. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the television had hundreds of channels. The shower and bath were perfect. The water temperature was just right. There were abundant towels and robes. There was a roomy safe for valuables and closets with a perfect amount of room for suits and dresses along with an ironing board. The breakfast was beautiful and the freshly squeezed blood orange juice was an all time favorite. This hotel is flawless as well as reasonably priced. We cannot say more positive things about any hotel anywhere in the world. The hotel is perfectly well situated. It is a 5 minute walk to the Metro and a 10 minute walk to the train station. There are wonderful restaurants in close proximity. If these rooms were for sale for a permanent residence in Rome, they would make perfect apartments. This hotel is a must stay for anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute treat!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Moses Fountain Hotel for 2 nights and were really happy with the level of service and the details in the room. The added bonus of a turkish steam room in the bathroom was a 1st, but is needed after a full day in Rome! The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The little extras like the free mini bar and Nespresso machine were also well received. The staff were very friendly and helpful, including out late arrival and helping with our bags. It is a little hard to find but is another interesting feature of the hotel! We would definitely stay again and would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Turkish hamman!”
Reviews.Author: curlygurly2002
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Moses. fountain in Rome. Hotel was beautiful and our room felt very private given that they were no guest rooms adjoining on any wall. After walking round Rome all day it was fantastic to return to a double sized rain shower and steam room! Having this extra certainly made the hotel and we made very good use of this facility. Etna toiletries were lovely, even as a woman I didn't even need to use my own! The staff at the hotel we very friendly, helpful and gave good tips about Rome. The hotel was a little tired around the edges but the quality of the bathroom, the service and the privacy definitely made up for this. This is not the hotel for you if you want 24 hour service etc but if you want a homely private environment I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best place value wise to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Eldose B
Reviews.Content: Sure the steps that greet you at the entrance might be a bit daunting if you have lots of luggage but this is a non-issue if you mention at the time of booking that you would need help on the luggage. Problem solved. The patrons of this hotel are friendly and pride on personalized service. Every evening a call will be made to your room checking to see if you need to make any dinner reservations or any help of any sort; on your check-in Eva will personally help in making sure your plans in Rome are well set, free wifi for any number of devices, free minibar that is refreshed every day and free breakfast is delivered to your room at the time of your choosing. We took the deluxe room which came with its own hammam steam room with soothing led color lighting. Elegant contemporary room design and a spotless bath. All at super super reasonable rates. Not to mention the hotel is centrally located - about 5-10 minutes to Spanish Steps. What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is like an upmarket b&b in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Ser579
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that is like an upmarket b&b. The staff are very thorough in making sure everything is great and offers suggested itineraries for visiting Rome. Chambermaid changes things in room more than once a day which was unexpected (and our room was a mess). Loved the room and soaked in the bath for ages!

Reviews.Title: “Not the traditional lodging.”
Reviews.Author: bbffpp
Reviews.Content: We weren’t sure if Moses Fountain deserved 4 or 5 rating. There is no 4.5 which would be adequate. We rounded to five because of Emma, who always did more and was so kind. First of all, this is not a regular hotel. This is quite clear in the reviews. First, the entrance is small. We didn’t have problems finding it because of pictures the hotel sent at the time of the reservation and reading other guests’ experience here. We arrived late after a delay in our airplane. So it was around nine when we got there. You ring and then someone opens the door for you, but the first you see are steps. They should beware about the steps in their webpage. Something strong people can manage easily, but I imagine some people didn’t enjoy them. At night there was a very kind young woman (whose name I can’t remember) and spoke very good English and Italian. She was by herself so we helped her carry our luggage (this was the time I thought about knowing of the stairs beforehand). We wished there was a front desk with someone available 24 hours. You can call the Richmond hotel, but we never did that. We felt that as they were far away was only for emergencies. Also, we didn’t feel it as a hotel but as a guesthouse. Next in the morning we met Andrea, who help us explaining and giving us some recommendations which didn’t work that well. But he didn’t not help us to reserve. I suggest solving their weak link by having a reception/concierge who not only recommend buy actually help you out to solve some things and reserve different options (private tours vs. going to the bus company across the street). The location is very adequate, close to Termini train station, and Via Veneto is just some minutes away walking. They recommend very good restaurants too. We had two rooms with them. The small one (medium category) was large enough, beautifully decorated, nice marble bathroom with excellent shower. It is an equivalent to a high-end four star hotel. The other was a deluxe room, which is the size of a five hotel room. Even without a tub, the bathroom was outstanding, with an incredible huge shower (with good pressure) and steam. The ETRO toiletries are a nice touch. You’ll find too sleepers and bathrobes. The beds are adequate with customized sheets. Although the web page describes massive breakfast, you get a continental one. Believe me, you won’t go hungry. They serve a lot of bread, fresh and packed cheese, marmalade, cappuccino, orange juice, cookies, pastries and other goodies. Fresher jam and bread would make it perfect. We enjoyed it a lot. Now, I’ll talk about Emma. She was really amazing. Did a lot for us, like checking if we were going somewhere we would find what we needed. Also se was really friendly and we felt how she enjoyed helping us. A good vibe you don’t get always in a top notch five star hotel. That made every other issue minor. I would stay again happily. What I loved, was the value. Although it is not cheap, is reasonable priced and value for what you get there. Once there, you don’t feel bad any moment because all is included. I recommended it to some friend for their honeymoon, they’ll love it (they already booked).

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: YChal
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed there for 5 days on our honeymoon and we got very happy with our choice. The location is one of the highlights - very close to the metro station (2 minutes) and many bus stations, so it was very easy to go and return whenever we wanted from everywhere. Besides, it's very close to some famous points, like the Trevi Fountain (walk of 10 minutes), Spanish Steps. A calm 5 minute walk to Termini Station. Thanks to this great location, we didn't have to take any taxis in the whole trip, what resulted on an enormous economy to us - of money and time, once the traffic is hard. Everything can be easily achieved on foot or by bus or metro. We stayed on the blue room and it was great: large, had a quiet and powerful air conditioning, frigobar included (it was very nice to have a cold Coke when we arrived after walking hours on that hot hot hot weather), big bathroom, very clean. Very quiet, we didn't have any trouble with any noises. The staff is very friendly, Emma is the best guide ever, she gave us a map, told us how to get there, when to go, many useful information in a perfect english, like the rest of the staff. Internet works very well in the rooms and it's also included - more economy, cause we used the skipe to talk to our families. Breakfast is ok, with a delicious capuccino served on a terrace. It's not fancy, it's practical and comfortable. There are stairs to the rooms and no room service late at night, but it's not important when compared to the many benefits. Every guest holds a key to the main door and to the room, so there's no doorman, it's like a "family house". We would stay there again and we strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Living in style like a local”
Reviews.Author: ManilaMacedon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November after some official business elsewhere. I must admit, the stairs were a challenge with a heavy suitcase, but everything after was great. I stayed in the Swanky Cardinal Room which is stylish, large, clean and has a great view with its own terrace. The street noise can be a bit bothersome, but I'm thinking the St. Regis next door would have the same problems. I always travel with earplugs anyway. This is more like a serviced home rather than a full service hotel, but they reminded me that anything I needed was just a phone call away. Service was perfect. Warm, genuine and personal. Much better than a large hotel. The atmosphere of the place is so relaxed and inviting. It's as though you were going home to a great apartment in Rome. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: PackMyBagsInPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough good things about Moses Fountain and its staff. They were extra accommodating. We truly have never received such great service in Europe. We were staying there for the first night of our honeymoon. After a long week of family activities, the wedding and the international flight, we were ready to relax and explore Rome. And based on the email conversations, we knew that Moses Fountain was the right place for us. From the initial email help to the arrival, the arrangement of transfers and the extra effort they put in helping to find our lost luggage, everyone was more than kind, professional, generous and helpful. The staff speaks English wonderfully and the service they provide is better than any 5 star hotel I have ever stayed in. They provide you with a free mini bar that is restocked daily and even went so far as to pour the drink for us when we arrived! The breakfast was fabulous and delivered to our room. This hotel is family run and you can tell--its like staying as a guest with a dear friend--anything you need or want, they are able to provide. In addition to calling the airport for us continually (and providing us updates on the status of the lost luggage), they assisted in recharging our Italian cell phone with money so we could make calls and they negotiated a better rate on the transfer when we eventually had to go to to the airport to retrieve the lost luggage. And even further, while we were waiting for our transfer, they brought us more drinks and told us to relax until they called us to go downstairs. I can't even believe how they helped make a stressful situation so much better. Although we did not get to see as much of Rome as intended due to the luggage incident, I know for certain that when we return, Moses Fountain is the only place we will consider staying.

Reviews.Title: “Service and tranquility in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Andrea P
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel pretty easily after reading some traveler tips and the email with directions and photo that the hotel had sent us when we booked the hotel. We were pretty worn out after an overnight train ride, but we walked up to the terrace and were greeted by the ever-gracious Emma. She sat down with us, gave us a map, talked us through the sites, gave us tips on booking tickets and made us feel quite welcome. We were also given the code for the free wi-fi right away. Our room wasn't ready yet (as we knew we were early - about 10:30 am), but they did carry our luggage up the stairs and were able to store it for us while we went out for the day. We didn't miss having a check-in desk one bit - if I could give them more than 5 stars for service, I would. One other thing to note is that everyone in the hotel does speak English very well - we could've gotten by on my Italian, but were much more comfortable knowing everyone spoke English. We loved our room - it was the green room and had plenty of space for a traveling couple accumulating gifts and souvenirs at the end of our European vacation. The room had wood floors, soft white comforters and a large, modern bathroom. The Tv had so many stations it was dizzying. it was great that wifi and breakfast were included - it made it seem like a good value. the breakfast was substantial and they offered cappucinos every day. in the evening, they set out wine and snacks on the patio. They also refilled the mini bar every day (for free). Jeanne and Emma were so helpful to us whenever we needed anything - the service was so amazing. We had a painfully early flight and they even arranged to have the cab company call 15 minutes before they arrived, so I wouldn't be worried/stressed. The experience felt like we were staying as a guests in someone's home - they cleaned the room every day and also did a turn-down service in the evening. There are no "do not disturb" signs, so if you find these services intrusive, you might be better off at a larger hotel. The one slight drawback is that the room was kept at a warm temperature which we couldn't figure out how to adjust, so we just kept the windows open, which did result in some street noise and mosquitoes. The neighborhood was in good distance of the major sites in room - either walking or a short metro ride away. The neighborhood around the hotel felt safe at night due to the numerous government agencies and was a good place to find local places to eat (less touristy and less expensive). The serenity at the hotel was a direct contrast to all of the sensory overload and slight chaos of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, modern, gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mikems10
Reviews.Content: Moses Fountain was one of our favorite hotels during our trip to Italy! We couldn't have dreamed up a better place to spend 4 days in Rome. The hotel is modern, clean, and charming; the location is excellent; and the staff is FANTASTIC. The hotel only has 7 rooms tucked behind a beautiful fountain. Although we booked a "superior" room we were actually put in an airy, seemingly brand new one bedroom apartment, complete with a little kitchen! The apartment had all the modern conveniences you could hope for: deep soaking tub, separate rain shower, bathrobes & slippers, SKY TV (includes US channels), flatscreen TVs in the bedroom, living room, and bathroom, FREE frequently restocked minibar, coffee machine, etc. We loved the roof deck where we had drinks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. Speaking of breakfast - it was my favorite breakfast of our entire Italy trip. What made this place truly special was the staff. They were attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond. Emma spent time with us each morning giving us sightseeing pointers, calling and making reservations for us, and making sure all of our needs were taken care of. The other staff were equally attentive, friendly, and warm. The guest service was better and more individualized than any other 5 star hotel we've stayed in which is incredible considering there is no reception desk. When we needed internet access they brought us a laptop, when I loved the lemon cake at breakfast they bought one for us so that I could take it home! The location was excellent for sightseeing however it was not in a bustling nightlife spot and se we happily walked to more lively places each evening. Things to know: there are two flights of stairs up to the rooms which were no problem for us but may be for anyone with a disability. The cab could not find the hotel even when we showed him the address. Perhaps if you tell your cab the address and tell him that this hotel is across from Chiesa Di Santa Maria Della Vitria or around the corner from the St. Regis Hotel you'll get there with no trouble. In summary, this place is awesome and I'm sure you'll love it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think twice...Book it!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MJRTZ
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. My wife, daughter and I had the pleasure of staying at the Moses Fountain for 5 days. It was the BEST hotel during our two week stay in Italy. Hotel: You enter through a side door go through two sets of stairs to go to the hotel. the hotel is immaculately clean. The scented smell is the first sign that this place is Special. The rooms are perfect. The bed is comfortable. The air conditioning is perfect. The bathroom is spacious and modern. All I can say is Wow! I was always happy that after a day of sightseeing I knew that we were coming back to this hotel. They also have a fridge with Sodas, Water and Snacks. they do not offer room service but there are tons of places to eat close by. Owner (Andrea): He was extremely helpful and made sure that we were satisfied throughout our stay. It was truly wonderful to enjoy the hard work that he has obviously put into this hotel. Location: Perfection. We walked to the Metro two blocks away. The bus stop is one block away. We actually walked to Trevi Fountain and The Spanish Steps. Although, the Metro is the best option you can also walk. we stayed in 3 hotels during our trip and this was by far the best choice. One more thing, you do not hear one bit of noise. I guess the windows and outside structure are made to keep the noise where it belongs...out of the room. i wish i could truly put into words how magnificent this property really is. My wife said it best...."This is the first time that you have been left speechless". She has never spoken truer words.

Reviews.Title: “4 great nights at Moses Fountain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliceA424
Reviews.Content: Moses Fountain was a great find! We loved the modern, clean, and quiet rooms in a great location. Emma and the rest of the staff went above and beyond to accomodate us. The little details really make you feel like you are getting your money's worth - from the daily turndown service, to the free mini-bar, and the excellent breakfast. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel (once you find it!)”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoW_traveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Moses Fountain Hotel for 2 nights (3 rooms) and it was really a great experience (once we found it!). It is behind a wooden door on a major street (XX Septembre) with just a small sign. Also, the street numbering system is strange, as the numbers descended down to 38 or so, then jumped up to 98 (L). Finally, the taxis at the Station did not want to take us because it was so close, so my wife and I walked for an hour trying to find it. However, I wouldn't let that scare you off. Once we got there, it was great. The rooms are really comfortable and the staff was wonderful. Emma spent a great deal of time with us mapping out our visit of Rome, and was incredibly accommodating, even making sure our special dietary requirements (vegans and gluten free) were taken care of for the included breakfast. It's also in a great location, and I would definitely stay there again (it will be easier to find next time!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique hotel...believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Juliedani
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel for just 2 nights in july 2011 and we wished we had stayed longer! Yes, there is no reception at this hotel, but Emma the owner met with us upon arrival,sat down with us to explain how to get to what we wanted to see, printed out our vatican tickets for us, gave us the password to their free wifi, recommended some restaurants and Jeanne (not sure if I am spelling that correctly) was almost always there to make sure we had everything we needed. If not, they were just a phone call away.Yes, there are 2 flights of stairs to get to the door of the hotel, but Jeanne was there to help us with our luggage and the stairs lead to a cute common area with a nice garden and view. What really makes this place is the personal touches. To the fresh fruit waiting for us the day of check in, to the (free!) minibar restocked twice daily with plenty of drinks and a few snacks, to even receiving a nightime snack upon returning to our hotel after a long day of walking through Rome! Every little detail was thought out,from the automatic blinds, to the cute little terrace, to the hundreds of channels on the television, to the luxurious soaps and beautiful decor in the bathroom. We stayed in the "Turtle Dove" room which was gorgeous, clean, and luxurious.The breakfast in the morning was included, and had a variety of fruits, breads, meat and cheeses. This was the last leg of a 3 week trip, and we had wanted to splurge on a really nice hotel for our last few nights in Europe, and we felt like Queens at the Moses Fountain, and were definitely spoiled! The location is perfect. 5 minutes away from 2 metro stations, and steps away from piazza de la republica. This hotel is charming, beautiful, thought-out and fun! Not many people can say they've stayed "in" a fountain. If I am lucky enough to return to Rome, I know exactly where I want to stay! The reviews aren't lying, we found this out ourselves! You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: MBoyden
Reviews.Content: First impressions can be deceiving. You enter the guest house through a door in the wall and then struggle upon two flights of stone steps to get to the entrance. However, it is well worth it. The staff is friendly and accommodating and prepared exactly what we requested for breakfast. The big surprise was coming back after a hot day of sightseeing to find a bottle of sparkling wine, fruit juice and nuts awaiting us on the terrace. We had booked the Deluxe room, which was large, clean and everything you could have wished for. (The standard rooms are smaller.) The location of the guest house is perfect for sightseeing and, although located at a noisy junction, our room was quiet given the excellent soundproofing and double glazing.

Reviews.Title: “First night in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kbrjbr
Reviews.Content: Thanks for a wonderful stay at Moses Fountain Hotel. The location is great, the room perfect with free mini bar, a wine reception in the afternoon, and great breakfast. Thanks to Andrea and his wonderful staff for all of their help. This is a perfect respite from your overseas flight for your first night(s) that is quiet, centrally located, and air conditioned. This is not a place if you can't do a couple flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but better this way”
Reviews.Author: meetjoeblack
Reviews.Content: First of all, you shall not expect a service like you are in a 5-star chain. This is a great hotel, that you are going to feel like being a guest in the house of an aristocrate. Only several people are working in this property. No hotel entrance(just a wooden hidden door) lobby, no front desk(you check in and out in your room, no concierge, but there are people are taking care of everything you need. And you feel really at home. You'll be welcomed by a very friendly lady, who takes you to your room. The rooms are very chic, spacious and comfortable. Suprisingly good as the photos you see on their website. Most probably the wall of your room will be behind the historic fountain of Moses. There is no breakfast whole or open buffet. You call 10 minutes before you leave your room and find your table prepared for you on the terrace. The location is not the best in Rome but very near to the touristic attractions. Never try it for business, but this is the one for a nice romantic stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: I_L0ve_Travel_Too
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel! Everything about it screamed Relax, then explore. We arrived from the train station tired and homesick and left refreshed and wanting more. The art in the hotel was breathtaking and the hospitality was so needed that I did not want to leave. I will only stay here when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully unique, spacious rooms and extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mmabuc85
Reviews.Content: The Moses Fountain is absolutely the best. The rooms are large, very nicely outfitted with top of the line amenities, inclusive minibar and free wi-fi. But it is the wonderfully gracious and friendly staff that will make your stay memorable. Plus, you have the unique experience of staying in a 14th century roman fountain. If you are visiting Rome, Moses Fountain offers the best experience.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: torn80
Reviews.Content: we only had the pleasure of spending one night in this most wonderful hotel. emmanuela greeted us on our arrival and explained the workings of the hotel. everything was so well thought out, from the remote control shades, to the gorgeous lamp on a dimmer at the desk. breakfast was lovely on the terrace, as was the mini bar, when my husband wanted a cold drink. i hesitate to write a review as the hotel does not have many rooms and i hope i will be able to stay there again when i go back to rome. thank you so much for making us feel so comfortable and taking care of all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and much more”
Reviews.Author: Cumbria72
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel purely based on the reviews on tripadvisor - we were not disappointed. We stayed here for a week in Theresa's Sofa a spacious room on the top floor with muted colours a relaxing space - a fantastic shower which was much needed as Rome in July was hot hot hot! A welcome surprise was the mini bar which was free and topped up daily a very nice touch. Breakfast was lovely and beautifully presented each morning. All staff were friendly and very helpful, gave lots of good advice on things to do and great places to eat. This place did'nt feel like your normal hotel it felt like you were in your own little apartment. It had a great view too over-looking the Santa maria della vittoria a beautiful church housing Romes most ornate decor which includes Bernini's work . The hotel frontage of the Moses fountain hotel was beautiful I can't imagine many places that you stay at are part of a fountain and a fabulous one at that. The location I don't think it could have been any better a short walk to piazza repubblica and piazza barberini, both places had metro stops very handy. We will go back to Rome in the near future and will stay at the Moses fountain hotel again I can't think of any better place to stay our experience was that good 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: desertrat036
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and wasnt disappointed in the least. Infact at the end of our Italy trip we spent one night in the luxurious Sofitel Hotel and my entire family wished we had gone back to Moses Fountain. The hotel was well located and easy to walk from most areas. Sometimes with the kids we'd cab it home from the further locations (vatican, Jewish Quarter). I really wanted a hotel with a personal touch and was not disappointed. We stayed in the "mini-apartment" for our family of four. The room was perfect and the kids liked the movie chanels in english as well as the large Japanese tub. There is a kitchenette, as well as multiple closets, master bedroom and a living room with a double pull out bed (which was perfect for the kids). Each morning we had breakfast on their deck overlooking the Ministry of Agriculture building. It's the personal touch that brought me here and would bring us back. Our arrival was at 9:30 pm; and still Andrea, the owner, met us at the door, showed us around the room and then personally walked us to that "mom and pop" restaurant we all crave when we get to a foreign country. Infact, that is how our 5 days transpired; each day sitting in the morning sun, sipping our cappucino and discussing with the owners (either Andrea or his sister Emmanuela) where to go, where to eat and how best to arrange the day. This is how I envisioned the trip and eventhough I had both Fodors and Frommers 2011 editions, I knew the advice of locals is invaluable. You wont go wrong with this choice! Whether it was booking a spa day for my wife at Emmanuela's favorite spa or getting us to the train station (Andrea was heading that way so he helped pull our luggage all the way and put us on the correct track for Florence), this is the kind of hotel we are always looking for. Email me with questions as I did with previous reviewers. Ciao!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: hiroba
Reviews.Content: The mosses fountain hotel is a very nice place if you are looking for a romantic holiday. Owners of the hotel are very helpful. The room design in beautiful and felt very warm .. There were small cafe's and Italian restaurants near by with great food. Rome is fantasti, we hope to come back very soon. The walk we did are in our mind...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeriousJuice
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days, good location, great staff, small enough room, large bathroom. Be sure to check out the church across the road.

Reviews.Title: “We named our dog Moses in honor”
Reviews.Author: JessnKen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night upon arriving in Rome from the US. We were exhausted from the travel and were greeted very kindly and patiently by the owner, who let us freshen up in a spare room and leave our bags for a few hours until our check-in time. He also provided a map and spent some time sharing good restaurant recommendations while warning us of a marathon that might disrupt traffic around town. The room itself was really beautiful, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the breakfast was a truly delicious selection of breads, pastries and treats. The location is situated nicely for walking tours of Rome. And, if you don't feel like touring, there's a monument on the outside wall which you can hang out at and people watch. We arrived home wishing we had spent another night or two at the Moses. When we got home, we got a new dog and named him in honor of this lovely launching point for a wonderful vacation. Superior and well worth any extra money spent to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed here longer”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary30
Reviews.Content: We were staying at Rome Cavalieri but they couldn't accommodate us for our last night in Rome so at the last minute we booked the Moses Fountain Hotel and on arrival we wished we had stayed there for the 7 nights we were in Rome. We were met by Emma who made us cappucinos on the deck area and drew on a map directions for the sites we were walking to that day, and also recommended a restaurant close by which we did go to and thoroughly appreciated the advice, having had very hit and miss experiences in Rome previously. Our room was the blue room and it was great. I think the owners have obviously travelled well themselves and know what travellers appreciate, and they had certainly thought of everything - complimentary wifi, complimentary drinks in the fridge, nespresso coffee machine, great wardrobe space, very comfortable bed, excellent hair dryer and beautiful bathroom. The breakfast was adequate and served by very happy staff on the deck overlooking the street which at the time we were there was lined with fully laden orange trees and very beautiful. The rate was unbelievably cheap for Rome and the biggest bonus of all is the proximity to Termini Railway Station and to most of the sites in Rome. We loved it and would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: EssexAnna
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Moses Fountain Hotel and it definately lived up to all our expectations. We were greeted on arrival and given plenty of information on how to get to different places and even the best places to have dinner. We stayed in the Red Room and it was beaufiful. The bathroom is amazing especially the Shower! Breakfast is included and was more than enough to keep you going throughout the day. My only comment would be that a pot of Tea or Coffee would be better than just a cup, although it was never a problem to get a refill.We had a small balcony which over looked the church of Maria de la Vittoria which housed a wonderful Bernini Statue. Well worth a look. We were able to walk to all places of interest with a few coffee and ice-cream stops along the way! I wish we could have stayed in Rome longer as it is an amazing City. We will definately be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Luxury and Hospitality at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: NortonNorthWest
Reviews.Content: Our welcome to the hotel was brilliant, the staff's attention to detail was unmatched in our experience - we never knew they were there and we would find our room cleaned at least 3 times a day. Nothing was too much trouble for Emma and Jeanette who were lovely, friendly and discreet. Our room was very well appointed with everything we could need, the decor was of a very high standard and very calming, it was a lovely space to be in and a lovely touch was the free fridge which was filled up almost immediately with chilled italian beer. The terrace was also lovely and a place we spent time planning our next trip out. The location was ideal, if you are happy to walk, everything is within a reasonable strolling distance. But remember if you are coming from Rome Termini, its only 5 minutes walk if you look at the map, a taxi may cost you up to 20 euros because of the one way system.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a "Gem"”
Reviews.Author: mkslack
Reviews.Content: The Moses Fountain Guest House is a keeper! I would definitely return to stay here again....upon our arrival, I have to admit my husband was skeptical as the door was locked and we could not get in.....I pressed the button and before someone could show up, a couple inside the door waiting for their cab to leave opened the door. There is no lift at this property and lots of stairs - our room was on the third floor with at least 75 steps up. Good exercise which got easier as the week went on. Emma met us and sat down with us over a cold drink and gave us instructions about the room and restaurants and sites, circled on a great map to see. The location of the MF is great and we walked everywhere. Being set into the fountain it is a unique location, next door to a very swanky hotel. The room was sound proofed with a wallcovering of fabric. Each room is different and unique. The air conditioning had been turned on - it was 80 degrees out.....and was most welcome. The breakfast was continental and delivered to the room or to the terrace within 10 minutes of ordering. Great pastries and cake, fresh fruit, cappucino and juice. The mini bar was greatly appreciated with cold drinks, bottled water and snacks.....Jen was a gem and so happy and friendly. We appreciated her help, as well as Emma's help. When having trouble getting our tickets to the Vatican, they did all they could to help us. Great service! And, yes, Emma -- my husband definitely would return to the Moses Fountain hotel. And, don't miss the Santa Maria della Vittoria cathedral directly across the street (Angels and Demons) - it was one of the prettiest we entered. That you all for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jueb0bs
Reviews.Content: When we arrrived we were met by the owner who gave us a cold drink and sat with us advising us on local tips to make the most of our visit. Our room was well appointed, comfortable and very tastefully decorated. The coffee machine and complimentary mini bar were very welcome additions, as there is no bar or cafe on the premises. This is a town house style accommodation and there is no formal concierge or reception but there is usually someone around or you can easily contact the reception of their other hotel. It is a great place to stay, luxurious without all the pomp and formality of a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A unique and brilliant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-Gos
Reviews.Content: The Moses Fountain hotel was a unique and fascinating place to stay in a wonderful city. We hadn't been to Rome before and after a tiring journey and walk from the main railway station we found the hotel pretty easily. It helped that I knew the door was round to the left of the stunning Moses Fountain. In future we would take a taxi which is a fixed price of 40 EUR from the airport (which we did on the return journey). We were quickly greeted and welcomed to our room by the co-owner. After checking the TV worked and a comprehensive run through of all the facilities we got a personal set of recommendations for places to eat and go to see. We had three days in Rome and three weeks wouldn't be enough! The room was magnificent - called Swanky Cardinal it had bright red walls and stylish contemporary furnishings. A real boutique hotel with unique features like a tiny little window overlooking the square and a huge full length window overlooking the Santa Maria della Vittoria church (the one in Dan Brown's Angel and Demons). This window had a cool motorised blind with a remote control and a small balcony to overlook the square and down the road to the Quirinale and presidential palace. The bed was very comfortable, good storage and there was a programmable room safe and a free Nespresso coffee machine and small mini bar. There was also an LCD TV with Sky. The best bit was the bathroom - a feature of any hotel built into a fountain! We had a huge rain shower over a sunken bath tub all set into a little tower. Overhead there were coloured LED lights and it really was amazing. I hadn't mentioned this feature to my wife who was rather blown away! The bath took a while to fill though as it was so large. Breakfasts were served on the terrace or in the room. We rang 10 minutes before we were ready and then it all arrived easily. A lovely continental spread which I don't normally eat much from but it was so tasty we cleared it. The cake was especially nice. We had no issues getting it served where we wanted. The staff were always friendly and although not all had fluent English we had no issues. The owners were fantastically helpful. We booked Vatican tickets on-line and they printed them and delivered to our room. Restaurant recommendations etc were good and very helpful. You also couldn't hear the fountain at all!! All in all a brilliant place to stay - very cool to stay in a fountain, especially in Rome. We had a lovely break and got a preview of the new room which was equally nice and a little larger for families? We wouldn't hesitate to return or recommend to others. Thank you for a brilliant stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppet7London
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed 4 nights at the Moses Fountain Hotel. We had a standard room (Sixtus Fith) which we found very comfortable; plenty of room and well appointed. We were well taken care of by friendly happy staff. Jarn (although I'm sure that's not the correct spelling) the maid could not have been lovelier, and Emanuela the owner was extremeley accomodating, very friendly/approchable and made us feel very welcome. Emanuela took the time to recommend a number of good restaurants which were located near to the sites in Rome that we were hoping to visit. We had an early start on our first morning and Emanuela arranged for our breakfast to be served in our room early. The hotel is well located, very close to Termini (the main railway station - with all the bus routes that one would expect from a main transport hub) and the Metro, which were in five/ten minutes walking distance. We throughly enjoyed our stay at the Moses Fountain and would highly recommend this lovely boutique hotel for your stay in Rome. We would not look for anywhere else to stay should we visit Rome again (which we hope to do).

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique B&B”
Reviews.Author: FAARN
Reviews.Content: We took a long time deciding which hotel to stay in in Rome and were not dissapointed with this choice. A few posts have said the service was terrible but we had exactly the opposite experience. On arrival we were shown all the best places to eat and visit. We had a large selection of restaurants that we were recommended before travelling to Rome but the hotel's recommendation were excellent (especially Babette near the spanish steps). Rome is very small for a capital city and as such the hotel was only ever a 20 minute walk from most attractions. It is also near the metro line to the vatican although we ambled back in around 45 minutes. We would strongly recommend walking everywhere as you seem to stumble upon hidden gems around every corner. Other posters have commented on the street noise and we have to agree it was noisy in the mornings. Having said that the bed was very comfortable and we never woke up in the morning not feeling refreshed. As far as value for money what can we say. we had the apartment with lounge, bedroom, bathroom and kitchen. It was expensive for Italy but reasonable for Rome. The breakfast was a little dissapointing with only the choice of a limited continental. More variety and better cheeses would greatly inprove this. On the other hand, there were always staff around to provide this and our mini bar was replenished twice daily. Overall we would recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, personalized service”
Reviews.Author: zoomr73
Reviews.Content: The Moses Fountain will stand out as one of the best hotels that my wife and I have stayed in while visiting Italy ( this is our fourth trip in the last three years). Emanuela, the owner's sister, greeted us immediately upon arrival and offerred us cappucini while discussing the various sightseeing options open to us. Although the hotel offers free wifi, I did not bring my laptop or smartphone on this trip. Upon hearing this, Ema graciously delivered her personal laptop to the room for our entire stay. She also upgraded us to a larger room when it became available on our second day. I cannot say enough kind things about her and her concern for our comfort. When I mentioned that we wanted to make a day trip to Naples and would need to leave early in the morning, she arranged to have some breakfast items brought to our room the evening before. The hotel is located a quick 5 minute walk away from Termini Station which we used as the start for all our trips- Villa de Este, Hadrian's Villa, Ostia Antica, as well as Naples. Although we were in the standard double room, it was quite large with a king bed which was made up with high end linens. The flat-screen TV was hooked up to cable which offered most of the usual American cable feeds. There is a small refrigerator which is stocked daily with drinks and snacks. Everything in the refrigerator is complimentary. The continental style breakfast is quite adequate with an offerring of fresh fruit, fresh juice, a variety of baked rolls, and hot beverage of your choice. The maid will either bring the breakfast tray to your room or you may dine outside on the terrace. The bathrooms are also large and feature a full size tub, rain shower, and double sinks. Also, there is nightly turndown service. You can take an afternoon nap, get cleaned up, and go out to dinner. When you return that night, you will find the room clean, the bed remade, and any used bath linens replaced. I have nothing negative to say about the Moses Fountain. Upon our departure, the owner, Andrea, escorted us to our taxi and verified the fare with the driver to make sure that we would not be taken advantage of. We truly had the most pleasant stay there of all our trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: joan_sf
Reviews.Content: Despite a small misunderstanding, we were extremely happy with our stay there. The rooms were clean, spacious and elegant. Comfortable beds and no problems noise-wise. Breakfast is more than adequate (there's a small terrace where it can be enjoyed when it's warm). Good location, close to Termini train station and Piazza della Repubblica (metro station), many attractions within walking-distance. Last but not least, the owners Emanuele and Andrea could not have been more helpful! Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience & great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenna198460
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from Rome after spending four very special nights at the Moses Fountain Hotel. From the moment we checked in, to the time we checked out, we received a very personal and attentive service from everyone we came in contact with - in particular, the owner Emanuela who was kind enough to spend a great deal of time with us and provide us with a lot of sightseeing tips and recommendations. It is fare to say that the Moses Fountain is more a boutique B&B rather than a hotel. While you may miss certain amenities such as reception and bar you get a far friendlier and intimate service. The owner also provided us with several contact numbers in the event that we had any problems, and we found that there was a maid on the premises most of the time anyway. We found the hotel by looking through trip advisor. We wanted something different and special and were certainly not disappointed. The fact the hotel is part of a monument really added to the experience. There are a number of steps to climb, however we did not find this to be an issue. Even my mother who has just finished chemo treatment managed without too much difficulty. The hotel entrance is not hard to find as some of the reviews suggest, and there is a clear well lit sign above the side entrance door. Myself and my husband stayed in ‘Theresa's Sofa’ and my mother and brother who we travelled with stayed in the ‘Swanky Cardinal’. Both rooms were fantastic, very luxurious and clean. Our room in particular was very spacious, with a fantastic steam room/shower. My mother’s room had a balcony with views of the Church Santa Maria della Vittoria. Both rooms had a free minibar and Nespresso machine. The hotel is in an excellent location, central to walking to the metro, Termini train station, Trevi Fountain, shopping on the trendy Via Condotti and The Spanish Steps. I was shocked to read one recent review which suggested that the hotel was writing the reviews themselves. This is absolute rubbish, and can easily be verified by clicking on the profile of each review. Some people are never happy and will complain and find fault no matter how good the service is. I generally find that it is easy to identify such people and ignore there comments. I urge people to do the same as it would be a shame to miss out on such an amazing experience, because of a minority of narrow minded individuals. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: tocororoParis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 wonderful days in Rome at the Moses Fountain Hotel. We found the hotel by looking through trip advisor . We wanted something beautiuful, unusual, and with style and that is just what we got . The hotel has lovely rooms and we were able to chose the Cardinal room which was fantastic with stylish furnishings , very new and clean and practically built into the fountain of Moses and believe it or not had its own turkish bath and a beautiful view over the Church Santa Maria della Vittoria with statues by Bernini. I mention this as it is a good reference point for anyone staying at the Hotel.The hotel is very central near Via Veneto , the Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps so perfect for us a we walked everywhere . The owners Emanuela and her brother Andrea could not have been kinder or more helpful and we felt pampered and happy with the attention they gave to us. . We loved the little touches that were obviously the result of a careful attention to customers ... lovely bouquets of flowers each day a well stocked and free minibar and the great treat of all ... our own Nespresso machine in the room !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great room. Great service!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaKTupelo_MS
Reviews.Content: We took a taxi from the train station to the hotel. The driver had a hard time finding the place because it's entrance is just a couple of large wooden doors. No awning or anything like that. My husband and I did not realize that it was actually built into the backside of the fountain or I'm sure it would have been much easier to find! Hahaha! Our fault! Basically if you are facing the Moses fountain you can just walk down the sidewalk to the left of it and you will come across the doors. There is a sign and a buzzer. We came in at night and the driver had called ahead to get directions so they were expecting us. A very nice lady greeted us at the door and helped us carry our luggage up. She gave us a tour of our room. Then the owner came and explained where we were and how everything worked and recommended a great restaurant for us. He let us know that he was there for us should we need anything at all. It was a wonderful welcome! The next morning we had an amazing breakfast which included and assortment of breads and fruit with some cheese and coffee and fresh squeezed juice. Also with the breakfast was a few cookies/crackers that we took with us to snack on later! It also had a mini bar with complimentary beverages. I thought it was delicious! It was brought right up to our room. Our room was very spacious with a king sized bed and very clean. The bathroom was great! It had double sinks and an amazing shower with an option of using it as a steam room. The location is great. It's within walking distance of fountains and basilicas which are absolutely amazing. In fact, right next door to the hotel is a basilica. You must go in there. It's breath taking! The train station is just a short walk as well. We got our Roma passes and boarded the metro and got around very easily! It was the perfect place for us to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Sydneygirl45
Reviews.Content: I was intrigued by the concept of a boutique hotel inside a fountain. The concept is great, but would I stay there again?, definitely not. Would I recommend it to a friend? probably not. It was OK. Rome is such a fabulous city, so the minor issues that we had with this quirky boutique hotel receded into the background. Nevertheless, we did leave the city wishing that we had stayed somewhere else. The negatives were, 1. no on site staff to help with directions and general travel tips (and definitely no room service) 2. an extremely ordinary breakfast, which we ended up skipping after the first morning. 3. the fountain mechanism made quite a bit of noise, although, they may have been having problems with it, because someone seemed to tinker with it the last night we were there and then it was quite a bit quieter. 4. the ventilation in the bathroom was apalling. The positives were, 1. a great location 2. a spacious room (we were in the largest room, featured in the brochure) 3. the concept of staying in an ancient fountain in rome was pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful - once you get inside!”
Reviews.Author: bornin42
Reviews.Content: We found this wonderful little (6 rooms, going to 8) hotel on Trip Advisor, and we loved it. There's only one catch - you have to know how to get in. It's in an old mansion hidden behind high walls, and when you arrive at the address (it's right behind the Moses Fountain), you will be confronted by a huge locked wooden door. We pressed the wrong button and got no answer, to our dismay. After walking around a bit trying to find another way in (there isn't one), we came back to the door and pressed every button we could find. I still don't know which one worked, but a voice came on the intercom and called us by name and let us in. The hotel has no reception area and no kitchen (just a small pantry from which a generous breakfast is produced and brought to your room), and after hours there is no one there to let you in, so you need to keep your key card with you at all times so you can buzz yourself in to that big door. There is a direct phone line to the concierge at the Richmond Hotel, and we used that several times with good results. Behind the big wooden door is a delightful, quiet, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel, and the location can't be beat - it's a 5-10 minute walk from Termini train station and very close to several sites with great Baroque art - 4 churches, Palazzo Barberini, etc. The hotel also has free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Dont trust the ratings and reviews at tripadvisor !!!”
Reviews.Author: P24-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel because of the excellent reviews it has received, but it its is not worth the money. In brief: very noisy and during the winter time quite cold (if you are using the heater you cant sleep because of the noise it is making). Furthermore no reception, no breakfast room and the breakfast as such is very poor. So how comes this hotel has received so many good reviews? Well, it seems that at some places (in this case Rome) some hotel owners are using tripadvisor as a free marketing tool. Very sad. So be careful and dont believe everything. I hope that tripadvisor will try to stop such misuses in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Great people”
Reviews.Author: Chris_upham
Reviews.Content: The entrance was a surprise, just a gate in a wall, but go in through the gate and up about 70 steps and you will find some fabulous rooms. The location is very central for everything, the staff are so friendly, particularly Andreas the owner who could not do enough for us, and he speaks excellent English. Whilst we were there it was our 44th wedding anniversary and he left a nice gift and a card in our room, a lovely touch. An excellent breakfast was served in our room each day. It is situated not far from Romes' main Termini and also near to the Republica subway station. It was like having our own private serviced apartment in town, what more could we have wanted. Andreas will arrange for a limo to pick you up at the airport for 55 euros or you could get the train, called the Leonardo Express, yes they manage to use his name as much as they can, which costs 14 euros each and gets you about half a mile from the hotel. If you are looking for something special and different this is the place. If steps are aproblem or you require big hotel facilities then it is not. We definitely recommend it. Chris & Margie Upham, Warrington , England

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Marcin70
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the very heart of Rome, only a few steps to the most attractive sites( trevi, spanish steps, villa borghese). Very near (500 m) to the Termini railway station so You can easily reach it on foot in 10 minutes. The quality and taste of rooms is perfect as well as cleanliness of it. In my opinion service is exceptional much better than expected although this is a very small property. Very tasty continental breakfast and a mini bar included in the price. Highly recommended , nothing more to add.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinarily wonderful”
Reviews.Author: EborTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you want something extraordinary this boutique guest house is as good as it gets. If it had a bar, a restaurant and reception it would command 5stars+. Due to availability I couldn't stay here for all of the nights I was in Rome and booked into Sofitel Villa Borghese for my remaining nights and found Moses Fountain far more appealing. You don't need a reception as friendly staff await your arrival, and you don't need a bar or restaurant as there are so many to choose from nearby. I used the bar at the St Regis which is literally next door. High quality furnishings, free wi-fi and Nespresso as well as soft drinks and Peroni in the fridge made my stay comfortable and enjoyable. Quiet and classy, this unusual hotel is perfectly located for sightseeing and exploring Rome. I found the staff to be very accommodating and helpful and I was even recommended a couple of restaurants which I can pass on: Da Settimio all'Arancio - a traditional ristorante with a 'local' feel and Gusto - a classy wine bar and ristorante. The entrance to the hotel is directly opposite the church Santa Maria Della Vittoria, famous for Bernini's sculpture 'Ecstasy of St. Theresa' and also the setting of a scene from Ron Howard's film of Dan Brown's 'Angels and Demons'.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BakerCristian
Reviews.Content: I have only the kindest words to say about my recent stay at this small gem of a hotel in Rome. I used the rating system in Tripadvisor to locate a hotel for a one night's stay in Rome while on business. Upon arrival i was greeted by the charming Andrea, one of the owners, who welcomed me and gave generously of his time in explaining both the room and the location in Rome. The design is impeccable (Andrea is an architect) and the historic building has been lovingly and exactingly restored to perfection. While retaining the charm of an ancient building, the room and its spacious and luxurious bathroom (with bathtub...a rarity in Italy) are appointed with modern touches and smart colour palettes. I had a terrific night's sleep and the breakfast, brought to the room, was excellent and beautfully presented. I would stay there on any future trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, service not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: tipsyangel
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to say that the room we had was really nicely decorated, very fashionable and modern and well thought out. (nice little touches like a nightlight in the lower walkway from the bed to bathroom). It was a very comfortable room, the bed was very comfy and I felt quite at home there. The bathroom was luxurious and fantastic with really nice toiletries. The owners were both also very friendly and Emanuella took the time to provide us with lots of information about Rome and give us some guidance on things to see/places to eat etc which was really appreciated. It was therefore a shame that although the attention to detail was high in the set up of the room, that the service seemed to lack the same quality. For example; we were advised that we could call for breakfast in the morning and any request we had at any time would be welcomed. However when my partner called for breakfast in the morning and started to ask for breakfast with juice etc, he was met with the curt response that 'you will have the normal breakfast' now we were not about to ask for anything outlandish, but to be met with this sort of response is not good customer service as I would expect to have. Also we found the snacks in the mini bar were not replenished for the entirety of our stay (the drinks were; maybe the snacks were a one off, but when it is stated the mini bar is replenished twice a day, my understanding of that would be everything in it). One evening we had no milk left in the room, and this may sound like i'm being picky, but after a days sight seeing the last thing you want to do when you've just got comfy is chase around for milk. On the last evening we asked if we may have breakfast in the room that evening as we had an early flight the next day and would be leaving before the chamber maid arrived to make breakfast, which we were told would be fine, but then upon getting back to the room that evening - there was no breakfast, after speaking with the evening chamber maid - who was very friendly and pleasant but unfortunately we couldnt understand each other, she called the Richmond hotel, I then spoke to reception there, who then spoke to her etc etc and we did eventually get part of a breakfast, but it all seemed a lot of effort for things that should just be part of the service. We also had a nice flower in the room at the beginning of our stay, it was still there dead and wilted at the end, in my opinion, it may be the fact that we were going the next day for why the flower wasn't changed/fruit bowl wasn't replenished, just remains of which put in the fridge/toiletries not replenished, but it is these types of things that I would expect to be taken into account for the price of the stay and I believe that it shoudn't matter when you are leaving, you should not be treated as 'oh well, they leave soon, dont bother'. We did also find the room quite noisy as the walls seemed quite thin and you could hear the buzzer next door/phone/ footsteps like they were in the same room. I spent alot of time researching to find the 'perfect' hotel as this was for a special trip for my partners birthday, which adds to the disappointment in the type of things I have mentioned. It is a shame that I would have to say I would not recommend this hotel from the experience we had, but if it was down to the room and owners alone it would be a different story.

Reviews.Title: “Secret jewel hidden behind a fountain”
Reviews.Author: kacan
Reviews.Content: Perfect location near historic sights, the hotel lies behind the Moses Fountain. Emanuela and Andrea are unbelievably hospitable and nice, my family were welcomed warmly. The rooms are beautiful and bathrooms are luxurious; there was very little sound from the street. The bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was included and appreciated, plus high speed wi fi. Staying at the Moses Fountain Hotel was a unique experience and I hope to visit again. It was absolutely delightful. We especially appreciated Andrea and Emanuela.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, One of the Staff Could Use Some Work”
Reviews.Author: pia_traveler519
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great; cleaner, nicer, more modern, and unique than any other I have stayed at in Europe for the money. Although it's not cheap, but nothing good in Rome is. We did have some minor complaints about one of the staff, I will get to that in a bit, and I don't think we were the only ones. We stayed for 5 nights total. One at the beginning of our trip and 4 at the end before coming home. We stayed in the mid-grade rooms both times, the blue room (Indigo, I think it's called) and the brown room (Turtle Dove, maybe). As many have already written you enter through a door around the corner from the fountain itself and climb many stairs to get to the 6 rooms. We were prepared for these details thanks to the reviews on TripAdvisor. The location is minutes away from a metro stop and its not much further to Termini train station. The minibar is complimentary and they even provide complimentary wine and cheese on the terrace in the evening if the weather is nice. We even had some complimentary wine and cheese offered in our room one evening because it was raining. The owners were very helpful, gave a good dinner recommendation, and arranged for transportation to the airport the day we left. Breakfast is included and served either on the terrace or in the room. It includes bread, croissants, cheese, fruit, coffee, etc. The first morning we were there we were served breakfast in our room by a very nice staff member (Laura I think) who didn't speak much English but it didn't really matter. She was very nice and helpful despite not speaking much English. During the second stay there was a different staff member working the mornings and that's where we ran into some minor problems... I don't think we ever got her name but she spoke pretty good English. The first morning with her we requested breakfast in our room and she obliged but made a rude comment about it supposed to be served on the terrace that day. I understood that but we were told during check in the first day that breakfast was usually served on the terrace during nice weather but it would not be a big deal if we wanted it in our room instead. As it was October and the mornings can be a little cool my wife preferred to have breakfast in our room. The next day day I ordered breakfast in our room again from the same staff member and ordered cappuccinos thinking she would need to know the type of coffee we wanted. This somehow upset her and she snapped at me: "The menu is the same as yesterday!" The next two mornings we just asked her if it was alright to have breakfast in the room trying not to upset her. She obliged each day but it was clear she was not too happy about it. I know all this isn't a big deal but she could definitely use some instruction on offering better service. We pretty much laughed it off and made a joke over which one of us would have to order from her. But someone else might not take it so well and let it sour their experience at this wonderful hotel. On the morning of our last day, on our way out with our bags, my wife heard this same staff member arguing/scolding another couple of guests. Not sure what was going on there but maybe we weren't the only ones who had issues with her. We would stay again! Hopefully a certain staff member would have some better manners or not be working during our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel/B&B”
Reviews.Author: lucida509
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Moses Fountain Hotel the first few days of our recent trip to Italy. This was our first trip to Italy so I was a bit concerned about booking a room via email at a small, unknown hotel. However, the staff provided excellent communication from the time I made the reservation until the time we arrived. They are fantastic! They arranged a private driver to pick us up at the airport and it was not much more expensive than taking a cab. I highly recommend this option. The driver was waiting for us inside the airport and helped us with our luggage. It made our arrival so easy and smooth. We arrived at the hotel early Sat morning (10am) and were extremely tired. We were so pleased that they already had our room ready and waiting for us. They even brought us each a wonderful cappuccino and croissant. It was the perfect greeting to Rome. We loved the bathroom amenities. The shampoo, etc. smelled great and were a nice change from what you usually get at a hotel. The room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. The location is great. It is within walking distance of many activities and restaurants. If you are looking for a nightcap there is a small bar across from the fountain. Avoid St. Regis which is next door. The worst and most expensive meal we had in Italy was at St. Regis. The mini-bar is free and contains diet coke, fresca, water, snacks, etc. They bring your breakfast to your room when you are ready for it. The breakfast is typical italian fare. It was nice to have it brought to the room so we could eat as we were getting ready for the day. We were extremely pleased with our stay at Moses Fountain Hotel and will definitely return on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jillnelledun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moses Fountain during the last part of our honeymoon, and it couldn't have been more perfect. The room was luxurious and completely original. The view out our balcony was beautiful, and I think I have convinced my new husband that we need a sunken bathtub in our house! What really made this place magical was the staff. Emanuela was very welcoming and incredibly knowledgeable. She told us the best way to see her city in the short amount of time we were there, and she was full of great recommendations. She took care of us when we needed to book reservations and print our Vatican tickets. The Moses Fountain was a great location (close to the train station) with a beautiful room and fantastic staff. I hope we can visit again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been perfect but...”
Reviews.Author: Constance5
Reviews.Content: Moses Fountain Hotel has all the makings to be first rate. We loved the stye, our room, decor, location, linens, toiletries, terrace, plantings. This should and could have been the perfect hotel for us. However, there were problems which soured our experience. We arrived after a long train trip having to quickly drop off our belongings, freshen up and leave to make a reserved Vatican City time slot. So we missed out on a full meet and greet, staff was not present when we returned in the evening and despite a 4 day stay we never got an orientation. There were no written greetings in the room so we were on our own to figure out air conditioning, we weren't informed that the minibar was gratis until we inquired about fee schedule a few days later, for the entire length of our stay we had no orientation to the neighborhood and until we happened to returned our last evening to freshen up before dinner happened upon a delightful evening wine and cheese on the terrace we did not know it existed. When I informed staff that we hadn't known about the wine and cheese instead of an apology I was told that it was not obligatory. The first night unbeknowst to us the shower door leaked and I used all our towels to mop a very wet floor. The next day when I informed staff, I was told that I was using the shower incorrectly. When I asked that I please be shown the correct way to secure the glass shield I was told it was broken, the owner had been previously informed but hadn't fixed it and I would be given an extra towel to wipe up leaky water. I said I didn't want there to be problems with water damage and was then told I would be given 2 extra towels. Not what I expexcted with the room rate we paid. A key swipe was used for most of the entry, at one we were unable to open the door to the outside which used a push button; when we asked staff how to operate the door we got an annoyed response. Maybe we hit an unusual weekend. With an attitude adjustment this would have been 5*s and an easy recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great style, great staff, great location, lovely extra touches”
Reviews.Author: annagrace84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. It's in a great spot in Rome, but isn't too noisy at night and is quite secluded for a hotel in the heart of the city! We stayed in the 'Swanky Cardinal' room, which was comfortable, stylish and very clean. The free minibar was very useful, as was the free wi-fi. The staff and the owners were very helpful, friendly and warm, and we picked up lots of tips on where to go in the city. In the evening, we were served complimentary wine, mozzarella and tomatoes on the balcony; with citronella candles and a warm night, it was a lovely experience. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: hoegy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so unique! Six individually decorated rooms that are embedded in the back of a beautiful fountain make for a romantic, slightly exotic, almost mysterious setting. Our room was complete with a balcony over the street and a sunken shower (yes, shower) in a tower. The bed was comfortable and the room immaculate. The owners were very sweet and helpful, and the rate included an adequate continental breakfast served on a private terrace. Not a great place for kids or the elderly as there are quite a few old stone stairs with few landings, but for us, on our 25th anniversary trip, it could not have been more perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A gem that ought to remain undiscovered!”
Reviews.Author: FranlandSheila
Reviews.Content: Moses Fountain is a real gem. It is almost impossible to imagine that you could find such a combination of uniqueness, centrality, comfort and personable attention by an owner in any major city but Moses Fountain and its owners fulfil all of these criteria and more besides. You actually stay in a fountain!! The decor is beautifully restrained yet opulent and the service and attention by Andrea and his staff is second to none. It is less than five minutes from Termini, making onward journeys by train all the more easy. Don't miss an opportunity to experience this rare example of genuine hospitality and service.It seems crazy to classify it as a B & B. Sheila and Frank, Ireland..

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful alternative to a...”
Reviews.Author: klpb
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful alternative to a traditional hotel! Each room is unique, tastefully decorated, comfortable and very clean. The bathrooms are spacious with designer toiletries provided. The robes and slippers are a welcome comfort after a long day of sightseeing and the free minibar is a rare find. Breakfast is a wonderful array of pastries and fruits enjoyed on the lovely terrace overlooking Santa Maria Della Vittoria Church. Manuela was an incredible hostess and was always available for every need. Upon our arrival she spent an hour with us marking a map in great detail, giving directions, recommending restaurants and providing helpful tips for sightseeing that were invaluable. I cannot say enough about this lovely hotel and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Rome. Be aware that there are quite a few stairs to climb to the entrance but worth every step!

Reviews.Title: “A little calm in the eye of a storm”
Reviews.Author: kazenette
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband spent the first four days of our honeymoon in this elegant establishment and we cannot recommend it enough. The decoration is sophisticated throughout and in an extremely busy city at the height of summer it was great to return to the calmness and quietness you find here. Emanuelle was more than helpful,pointing out all the interesting and less touristy places to visit and great local restaurants.Unfortunately we had a power cut one of the nights in the local area,and although the aircon and lights were out till the morning, the owners did their best to keep us informed and compensated us for the inconvenience even though the situation was not of their making. I have been to Rome many times but this is by far the best place I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking, this is the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: cakeaway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Moses Fountain Hotel with our 18month old son for 2 nights, and absolutely loved it. The hotel has a fantastic location, and the rooms exceeded our expectations. The rooms were very clean and modern, with free mini bar, free Nespresso Coffee Machine, and free Wi-fi for the internet.
