We ate our breakfast on the Terrace overlooking the street. The hotel provided a port a cot, for our son to sleep in, and they also provided a carton of milk for him to. When we arrived the lovely lady spent 30 minutes with us explaining how everything in the room worked, going through tourist attractions and places to eat. When we do return to Rome this is where we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mmabuc85
Reviews.Content: The Moses Fountain is truly a wonderful gem of a hotel in the heart of Rome. Andrea and Emanuela are such gracious hosts; they make you feel like you are visiting old friends, who happen to live in a very stylish guesthouse located in a 16th century fountain. The rooms are large, very nicely decorated and maintained in impeccable condition. The bed, linens and toiletries were all top of the line. Everything is included, from the high speed wireless to the mini-bar and a wonderful breakfast with cappuccinos on the terrace. These are very nice benefits compared to other “luxury” hotels that charge exorbitant fees for such amenities. We stayed in the Swanky Cardinal room which was right inside the front entrance. We were initially a little concerned about the potential for noise of people coming and going past our room late at night or going to breakfast in the morning. However, the room was amazingly quite and we were not disturbed at all. The location, which is a little off the beaten path, is very central and close to everything and as close to perfect as you could get. You can walk just about everywhere within 10 mins. Andrea was wonderful and made every effort to make our stay as relaxing and enjoyable as possible. He marked a map with several non-tourist restaurants in different parts of the city for us; we used two of his recommendations and enjoyed the best meals of our stay in Rome. Prior to our departure, he even gave us a tour of the old Moses Fountain and the old aqueduct that supplied water to the fountain; this is where the new reception area is to be built. The Moses Fountain is a lovely slice of Roman life and a great way to truly experience the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - loved it in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Pistol007Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May for a 4 night stay. What can i say that hasn't been said? -The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the Termini Train Station which makes it very handy to get to after you fly in to Rome. The tour buses all run from just around the corner at the Piazza de Repubblica. The owners, Emanuel & Andrea, are fantastic from the personal greeting upon your arrival to excellent "non-tourist" restaurant recommendations to the amazing breakfast served at your request in your room or on the terrace by the maid Mai. I cannot fault this hotel and would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WheelsOnTheBus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moses Fountain mid May for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. At first we didn't love the location as the centro storico had more character but by the end we really liked it. Very central to sites such at Borghese (10min walk) and Coloseaum (10min walk) plus there were plenty of places to see around the area. The rooms are immaculate. We had a room on the lower level which was large with a huge bathroom. Breakfast was excellent. Coffee, brioche, fruit, bread, etc. Adrea was most hospitable and a very genuine man. He had excellent advice on what to see, how to get there as well as advice on some excellent local eateries. The only downside was that it is quite expensive but all hotels in Rome are expensive and it is not possible to fault what you get for your money. Finally I must apologise to Beth2222 for being Australian and having a small child. Generally after an international flight the body clock tends to be out of whack hence the early mornings. Not sure what I can do next time about being an Australian. For the record we couldn't hear any of the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “more like an little apartment than a room”
Reviews.Author: BBES
Reviews.Content: if you do not mind a few flights of stairs this is a pleasant alternative to the usual hotel room, you get a bit of space, personal and refines furnishings, a lovely bathroom and even your personal steam-room with views over Rome.... the owner's great city tips are another bonus, really worked out great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, Personable and Perfect for romance”
Reviews.Author: Beth2222
Reviews.Content: Invested a lot in our search for a decent hotel in Rome, as had heard from many sources that hotels and standards can "vary". Reason the Moses Fountain was literally because it was the only one on Trip Advisor where all guests had recommended it. At the risk that the owners had a large, loyal family , we booked it for our 4 nights in Rome. We were met by an extremely hospitable owner who gave us some great sightseeing and places to eat recommendations as well as a mobile number no. in case we had any problems (this little 6 roomed boutique doesn't have a reception). The room was always clean, the hallway was always immaculate, a breakfast of cappuccino, juice and croissants were brought to our room each morning. On the last night we were upgraded to the deluxe Theresa Sofa room which was huge, beautiful and had a shower room with pretty moodlights and a little window where you could watch the hustle bustle of Rome as you showered (hey it beats singing!). Only small downside was that from our first room we could hear the people in the neighboring room getting up at the crack of dawn each morning, they were Australian and had a small child. But apart from that the bed was extremely comfortable and it's been a long time since I slept that well. (The deluxe was on it's own at the end of the hallway so noise wasn't a problem). We found the hotel to be very located and managed to see so many of Romes numerous sights on foot. The Metro is 2 minutes away if you don't want to walk. The Church opposite the hotel holds Bernini's Ecstasy of St Theresa and you should pop in to see it (Shamefully only found this out later when reading Angels and Demons). Despite being comparatively expensive to hotels in Ireland would certainly want to book this hotel again if I returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: katekuwait
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Moses Fountain as part of our honeymoon and we really enjoyed our stay. The welcome from the management is warm, friendly and informative. They provided us with a beautiful display of red roses and a bottle of nice local red wine to mark our honeymoon. It's personal touches like these which really make a hotel special. We stayed in Theresa's Sofa and the Swanky Cardinal rooms and both were beautiful, simple, fairly spacious, very clean, interesting bathrooms (Theresa's Sofa's shower is fully tiled and doubles as a steam room, Swanky Cardinal's shower is enormous, all tiled and also acts as a massive bath, it's quite difficult to describe! You'll have to book in to see what I mean...). There's an outside area where we sat and had late afternoon drinks and always felt comfortable and welcome. The only slight negatives: it's a bit of a walk to the main touristy stuff but nothing in any way unmanageable. The hotel is right on an intersection and there was quite alot of traffic noise, but with windows shut it was quiet, and each room has it's own A/C so closed windows is no problem. It was brilliant to stay inside this old monument. In the photos you can see the old building and the rooms are literally behind that facade. Only in Rome! I'd strongly recommend this hotel, it's lovely to stay somewhere small and personal where they go the extra mile to look after you as a customer. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “It can´t get any better”
Reviews.Author: viana_lx
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! It definitely rates as best one can find in a big city! Getting there was very easy, just a few minutes away from Termini. We had a very warm welcome by management who strived to give us all the possible information in little time. The fact that the Hotel does not have a reception desk might be misleading as it leads to a personalized service form management. All the tips for getting around and for meals were spot on, as we were looking for the spots that the locals go to and not necessarily the Tourist spots. Just amazing. The Velvet room was great. What a lovelly gem. Breakfast was brought to our room when requested, and it was a shame that we did not have the chance to have it in the little terrace. This fabulous experience will stay in our memories for a long time. Thank you Emma and Andrea!!

Reviews.Title: “For those who appreciate small scale hotel, comfort and discretion”
Reviews.Author: SE63
Reviews.Content: The Moses Fountain Hotel is a challenge to find yet once the dark door at the street side is found (push hard) and the stairs have been climbed (not the best place for persons with disabilities) you will find a small boutique hotel that offers comfort and discretion. We stayed in the Swanky Cardinal Room. Asset was the terrace with view on Santa Maria della Vittoria church and a nice bathroom (special bathtub/shower as part of tower). The service was excellent. Breakfast was served in the room and provided a nice combination of fruits, pastries, capuchino, biscuits, fresh fruit juice). The minibar was for free and was filled again every day. Wireless was also for free. The room was smaller than we expected and without the terrace it would have felt too small if you stay for a number of days. The fact that the hotel does not have an own reception not restaurant did not bother us at all. The location of the hotel allows to explore Rom on foot. Overall a very nice stay of which we have fond memories. S & E

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE...”
Reviews.Author: BrigitteRomania
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome to the Moses Fountain Hotel in February and I stayed for 4 nights. The location was very good because it is a few minutes away from many tourist attractions and travel connection. The hotel is very special because the host makes you feel special and welcomed. The rooms (and the whole building) are decorated in different styles, very- very cozy, very clean and bright. The staff was extremely friendly and willing to share with us useful information and things of general interest, too. Even from the first day, they were very helpful and open people, and I would highly recommend this place. I'm looking forward to going back, and it's important to mention that I am a demanding person with high expectations. Many thanks to The Architect (the boss :)) although we have not met in person, who created a wonderful place. Love you, Dear Donna Manuella, you are a special person. Thanks a lot and glad to met you, Profira..:) See you soon, Brigitte Furdui

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Vaction!”
Reviews.Author: kaychris
Reviews.Content: LOVED the Moses Fountain Hotel! We had great personl service from the 2 owners who greated us and help carry our bags to the room. Good suggestions for the area and amazing breakfast in the morning. The shower was amazing and the remote control blinds were a fantastic touch. Great, romantic red swanky cardinal room for the first stop on our honeymoon trip!

Reviews.Title: “A hiddden gem...”
Reviews.Author: SINBOY
Reviews.Content: The Moses Fountain Guest House would not appeal to everyone. However if you are looking for a unique experience and something a little different, then this is for you. Finding the hotel is the first challenge. Although it is within walking distance of the Republica Metro Station and a little further to Termini Station, I would recommend you take a taxi from the airport (FCO). It should not cost more than EUR 40 via a meter taxi. Don't let the drivers intimidate you if they offer a "flat fee" of EUR 60+. Just say no and wait for the next one. The hotel is located almost directly behind The St.Regis Grand Hotel. Just to the left on the corner. The Moses Fountain itself, is currently under renovation ( under the direction of the hotel owners) and is hidden by scaffolding. It is set to open hopefully in the spring according to Andreas. Once you find the hotel ( a simple wooden door built into a big concrete wall - opposite a church) and press the buzzer another world awaits you. If you have problems climbing stairs - this is not for you. You will need to carry your luggage up several flights to reach the front door of the hotel/guest house . There you will meet Andrea or Emanuela. The rooms (6 of them) are all different - but spacious. We stayed in a standard room. The bathroom was a big size and was a treat to use. Although the double bed seemed a bit on the small size it was reasonably comfortable. Free wifi and sat tv was good ( hint - some movies you can switch to English) Breakfast was delivered daily by Mae. An excellent choice of fruit, breads / toast , fresh juice and Cappuccino. A great way to start the day. All the sights of Rome are carefully explained by Emanuela , including good restaurants to eat. (We sat near Samuel Jackson at "Le Taverna" around the corner ) Food was excellent. This hotel is highly recommended for couples or singles who want a "non hotel" feel. Please try it out. D & R - Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: iluvtotravel28
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Rome, Italy I would highly recommend this beautiful hotel. It is located close to all of the attractions that you would want to see while in Rome. The hospitality is amazing and the rooms are nicely decorated. You are served breakfast in your room and it is delicious. Nice breads, cookies, cheese, cappacinos etc... You are within walking distance to Trivi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Coliseum, and many many museums. I can't wait to return to Italy and I will be staying at the Moses Fountain again!!! Cheers, sunshinesincda28@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: charlesmarlborough
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moses fountain hotel for 5 days at the end of October. I searched for several hours on the internet before finding this gem. It is a little different. There is no reception, no gym, no sauna no swimming pool no fancy restaurant and no bar. These are all facilities that you usually look for in a hotel of this price range but rarely use. Who wants a gym in Rome? Surely you want to eat out, and Rome is full of lovely bars and restaurants. What you do get is real attention to detail, Emanuel met us on arrival and told us lots of key information about the city. Drinks - there is a free mini bar with beer, coke and nibbles. Breakfast is served either in the room or on the terrace and is delivered by room service at your request. Now for the best bit. The room we stayed in (Deluxe - Red Room) was absolutly stunning with a gorgeous balcony overlookig the church opposite. The Bathroom was incredible - a large sunken bath with the best shower I have ever seen. To summarise the hotel is not your normal 5 * it has a large set of stairs to climb (no lift) and is a little quirky. However, it provided us with the best holiday we have had in years - I have never been to Rome before but I think we might make this an annual trip now. You should definately consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go past this hotel - fantastic value for money!”
Reviews.Author: 22bld22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! Although it's hard to find, once you've found it you won't want to leave. This isn't necessarily what you'd call a hotel, it's more of a 'aparthotel', with a series of small apartments. There is no 24 hour reception, so you need to let the hotel know what time you will be arriving. But don't be discouraged, the lack of front desk most definitely does not equate to a lack of service. The service at this hotel is excellent. The staff are friendly, very helpful and will show you great places to visit and restaurants to eat at. They also clean your room more than once a day! In the winter, they serve you breakfast in your room. This hotel is quite a way from most of the major attractions. However, Rome is already quite spread out, so no matter where you stay you need to walk, take a bus or taxi so don't let this put you off. This hotel is just so lovely because after a busy day in sometimes hectic Rome, the hotel provides a nice getaway. There is some traffic noise, but it didn't bother us at all while we were there. And as an added bonus, the minibar is free, which includes beer, soft drink, chips, nuts and more. There is also an espresso machine all to yourself in your room! Make sure you stay at Moses Fountain as it is something of an attraction itself - it is GREAT value for money. I'd probably get in quick before they start charging more, because they should be!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Jason2tf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made our first trip to Italy this September and our first stop was in Rome. After wading through pages and pages of hotels on various travel sites including TA, we stumbled upon the Moses Fountain Hotel - And I'm sure glad we did. For Americans, traveling in Europe without a tour can be an interesting endeavor. In the US we're used to consistency across hotel brands and general consistency in room sizes. This couldn't be further from the truth in Italy (or old Europe) where a city's age has a lot to do with dictating the size and amenities of a hotel. Admittedly, we were a bit nervous as we saw a lot of inconsistency in the reviews for supposedly good hotels. Furthermore, price didn't seem to have any impact on quality. Needless to say, we weren't sure what to expect. Then we arrived at the Moses Fountain Hotel and had what we consider as the best stay of our trip. Our room was the "Swanky Cardinal" which was decorated in a lovely and ironically sinful red. The room was spacious by Italian standards with a good sized bathroom and a balcony overlooking the hidden gem of Santa Maria della Vittoria. The bed was comfy and the communication options (TV/wifi) were great. Also, the free mini-bar was a lifesaver when coming back from day long walks in Rome. I would like to give special attention to our shower. I want one of these in my eventual home. It was a wondrous, mosaic tile laden relaxation place with fun fiber-optic lighting (I took night showers just to use the lights). Very tall and about two to three times as wide as any other shower I used in Italy, it was the greatest amenity we had on our trip. The location of the Hotel was fantastic - right in the triangle between the Via Veneto, Trevi Fountain and the Termini, it was quick to walk anywhere. In fact, that's one of the best parts of Rome - as long as you're not on the edge of the city, you can walk ANYWHERE. As a result of its central location, the MFH worked out great. There is plenty to eat in the surrounding area as well (after a few block walk to the right of the side entrance you can still find good dinner at 10PM on Sunday). Some folks on TA have complained about the noise. We really didn't notice it. It's city noise and we've both lived in cities in the past so what's there is to be expected. I'd be surprised if anywhere else in Rome with exterior windows was different. We also felt very safe here and the room has an ample safe where I could store my electronic gear and cash without worry. The owners and staff were wonderful and I need to give a special thanks to Emmanuella (hoping I didn't misspell her name). She greeted us so warmly after what had been a long overnight journey and got us entirely situated in our room and in the city. Daily breakfast was a treat - we never made it out on the terrace for it, but it was nice to have in our room. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and would love to come back and see the lobby when it's done (they are currently renovating the fountain and entrance - we didn't experience any noise from this). Of the 4 places we stayed in Italy, this was easily the best!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to be!”
Reviews.Author: SoundadviceAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Moses Fountain is absolutely stunning. A small hotel (6 rooms i believe), great location with Rome' s center within walking distance. Extremely nice staff who have a lot of knowledge about where to go and where to eat ('tourist free' restaurants which demand a little understanding of the language). Spacious rooms with Nespresso machine! (and we had the one with our own hammam). Breakfast was served outside on a roof terrace. Entrance of the hotel is a little hard to find and most taxi drivers probably don't know the place. So you bring the exact adres when you arrive. We spend a week there on a Honeymoon. If you plan your Honeymoon (or any other excuse) and you are not looking for hotels with uniformed doorman, a 24/7 reception or a breakfast buffet, check out Moses Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, contemporary decor and central location.”
Reviews.Author: allens11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the "Turtle Dove" room at the Moses Fountain. We were pleased with our stay but feel that some of the reviews here are a bit overstated/inflated with respect to some elements of the hotel. The good: The rooms are well appointed with modern, chic decor and include free WiFi, complimentary drinks (beer, soft drinks, water, Pringles, nuts), continental breakfast, a spacious bathroom and nice (Etro) bath products. We were met and greeted by Andre and given a very comprehensive overview of what to see and eat. Andre's restaurant recommendations served some of the best (and, might I add, non-touristy) food we had while in Rome. The location was great and we did not at any point think that the area was seedy or dangerous (this was one of my chief concerns when booking the hotel) relative to any other big city. The hotel even gave us a free bottle of wine one night. We had a very early checkout and Andre met us at 6:30 am. He was prompt and cheery. The cons: From reading some of the reviews, you would expect the rooms to be palatial, but they are not. They are certainly nice and well decorated but they were not so big as to warrant the effusive comments that others have made in their reviews. Perhaps this point isn't so much a "con," since we were just fine with the room size, but we just think it's necessary to manage people's expectations when reading some of the reviews posted on here. So, in summary of this point, the Turtle Dove room (which was a "superior" type/priced room) was average. The bathroom, however, was quite spacious and the appointments were excellent (two basins, large shower/tub). We could definitely hear our (adjacent) neighbors on 2 of the 4 nights we stayed at the hotel. Also, each morning, we could hear Emmanuela getting breakfast ready in the hallway/small work room. This is probably my biggest complaint about the hotel and the place where they could use the most improvement. Lastly, the hotel was difficult to find. As other reviewers have mentioned, the best way to find it is either to reference the St. Regis hotel (around the corner from the hotel) or the Church of Saint Mary of Victory (immediately across the street). The hotel did, however, send us a picture of the front door/entryway which was extraordinarly helpful as it gave us an idea of what to look for. Parting words: All in all, we thought the Moses was a nice hotel for the price. I liked the hotel but nothing about it blew my mind as some reviewers seem to suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: realtorrenonv
Reviews.Content: This seven room hotel is located in the center of Rome, within easy walking distance of most major sights. Owner, Andreas, and his sister, Gemma, were very welcoming and helpful in all respects. They spent a good deal of time with us when we arrived, orienting us to the hotel and the location. They were attentive to our every need, very nice people. Our room was furnished beautifully in a contemporary decor, it was very clean and comfortable. A very good continental breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent...!”
Reviews.Author: Edfreeman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moses Fountain at the end of October and booked on the basis of the excellent reviews. We would re-iterate all that has already been said about cleanliness and the personal service that Emanuella provides. There are some nice touches such as the room being prepared for the night, even when you have made a bit of a mess before going out for the evening! Our only disappointment was caused by the very thin walls in our room (The Blue Room). We were awoken on 2 of the 3 nights of our stay due to noises emanating from the adjacent room and this became a little intrusive. Other than this, we would definitely recommend the hotel and what you see written in the majority of reviews really does relate to the overall experience you will enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “great location and fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: KayCastleDonington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moses Fountain for 3 nights in early October whilst on holiday in Rome. We had some trouble finding the place - if you are in a cab tell the driver it is round the corner from the St Regis Grand. The rooms are fantastic - very modern but with nice touches such as the Nesspresso coffee maker and free mini bar with soft drinks and beers. What really makes the place special however is the owners and staff who are so helpful. When we arrived Emanuella, the owner, went through all of the features of the room and then spent time with us recommending places to visit and restaurants to eat at. On the first morning we had breakfast in our room as the weather was not too good but on the other days we ate outside on the roof terrace. The location is perfect - walking distance from Terminii and also from all of the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hideaway,friendly staff, comforatble”
Reviews.Author: Annie1323
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights recently. difficult to locate even for Cab driver, but once your there it's like being home. If you can't do stairs it's a bad choice as there are several flights up to the property.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Skeptical But Now A True Believer”
Reviews.Author: mlhom1620
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical with all the reviews I've read about Moses Fountain Hotel but now I am a firm believer of the recommendations and will definitely come back as my regular hotel. Location - a minute walk to the Repubblica Metro station where it takes you directly to the Termini station (the next stop) where you can access the Metro A and B line to all the historic location and sights. There is easy access to the 40/64 buses next to the Repubblica station where you can hop on and off to get to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc. Great location. Safe and convenient. Service and Hospitality - The best. Emanuella (the owner) and her husband Andrea waited for us. We were to arrive at 2:00 p.m. but finally arrived at 10:30 p.m. since our flight was over 8 hours late!! Emanuella took us in the room and personally showed us the facilities and suggested restaurants, sightseeing, and shops. Fruit basket, continental breakfast, free drinks in our mini bar was such a welcome treat. It was also our 20th year anniversary and we came back one night to our room to a nice bottle of wine! Free access to the wifi internet. Free drinks in the mini fridge, hair blower, in-room safe, and espresso machine. Facilities - Remodeled and brand new. Room was spacious (definitely for European standards!!!) clean, nicely decorated with modern . It had a double sink, marble floors, central air conditioning, bidet and best of all, the bed is large (queen size) and firm. Our room is soundproof and we did not hear our room guest in the next room nor any of the traffic from outside. There is a rooftop terrace where we had our breakfast (fresh squeezed orange juice, coffee, croissant, cheese, biscuits, toast, muffin, fresh melon). In the evenings, our room was turned down for the night. Summary Pro - Location, Facilities, Service, Hospitality, Newly Furnished Con - There isn't a "Con" since this was more than I expected. Don't expect that this is a full service hotel (laundry, concierge, phone line availaibility (unable to receive or call out), restaurant, lobby, etc. If you want a boutique hotel which provdes privacy, security, comfortable rooms, a nice bed, location, this is the place. If you want a 5 star full service hotel with a full restaurant, chauffeur, concierge, room service, spa, go to the St. Regis Hotel next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but not as great as you would expect from the reviews below”
Reviews.Author: roos1ter
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - this is a great place to stay in Rome - very clean, friendly and modern. However, I'm finding it hard to enthuse about it as much as the reviewers below. I can't but my finger on it. Maybe it's because I travel a lot with work and have certainly stayed in much better hotels, for half the price. I think it is expensive for what you get (although relative to other places in Rome it is good value), and somehow not very private or romantic. We stayed in a standard room, the "Golden Nest". It was a very nice room, but as it is directly next door to the staff quarters (and with a connecting door), you are woken every morning at 7.30 am by them getting the breakfast ready and receiving phone call etc. The other rooms are much further from the staff quarters, so I'd recommend you take one of them instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OPMatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moses Fountain for 2 of our 4 nights in Rome, and absolutely loved it. The only reason we didn't stay longer was because we had a free stay at the Hilton booked for the last 2 nights. What can I say about this hotel that hasn't already been said? It is such a unique and amazing place to stay. Yes, there are a lot of steps, but you completely forget that once you see your room. We stayed in the Blue Velvet room, which was by far one of the biggest rooms I've seen, by European standards. Plenty of room, high ceilings, freshly stocked fridge, fruit, double sinks in the bathroom, satellite TV, and in a great location (about 10-15 minute walk to most attractions). The other thing that really sets this hotel apart is the personal service. When we arrived Emmanuella spread out a map of Rome and gave us recommendations for things to do and places to eat all over the city. It was our first time in Rome, so this was extremely helpful. The restaurant recommendations were perfect. My wife and I loved the "non-touristy" places that she recommended. Also, since the owners have another hotel (Hotel Richmond, near the Colosseum) she invited us to drop by there for a rest and a drink if were going to visit that part of town (which we did!).

Reviews.Title: “A Mr & Mrs Smith Venue at an Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: Gringochichero
Reviews.Content: mr & mrs smith venues (not sure what I am talking about then goggle it) would struggle to compete with this jewel in Rome's crown hotel. The location was ideal 10-15 mins in any direction and you were at one of Rome’s major attractions. The owners recommendations for anything you wanted to do, see, watch, buy, eat were absolutely spot on. We experienced eating out in restaurants in the city that do not appear in any guide books enabling you to experience the best local cuisine at reasonable prices, real hidden gem restaurants away from the crowds but still able to understand the menu. The hotel itself was extremely clean and even the standard room we stayed in was luxury with a mini bar (that was free) along with nepresso coffee making facilities in the room. We sat out at night on the roof top veranda and enjoyed sipping wine in the cool night breeze, we also met some great people who were also staying there. I would definitely stay here again – it is hard to detail all the splendors of the hotel without leaving some great surprises for the next visitors to shout about. If you like boutique hotels with services to suit all travelers from business to family trips then I recommend you try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all your typical hotel, but very charming.”
Reviews.Author: mca269
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical hotel - no lobby, no reception/front desk, no 24 hour staff. It is about 6 rooms/small apartments located within the structure behind the Moses Fountain (currently under renovation). You'll need to let the staff know your arrival time so that someone can meet you there to let you in, assist with the luggage (up many steps!), and give you a brief orientation. Thankfully it was our 3rd hotel and 4th night in Rome and we were already a bit familiar with the area and knew what we wanted to do next. Our room was nicely decorated and very clean. The hotel is still new so everything is up to date and still in great condition. Though we had a standard room, it felt quite luxurious. We loved the fresh fruit bowl and the stocked refrigerator (restocked daily and included with the room rate!) Breakfast was served in our room (croissants, fresh squeezed juice, fresh cut fruit). You'll get very personal service from Emmanuella (owner) and May (housemother). The church across the street was an unexpected treat and many major landmarks are in easy walking distance. I'm a nervous traveler and this was my first trip to Rome. If Moses Fountain had been our first hotel on the first night, I would have been uneasy. Timing and independence are key since there is no 24hr staff on location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and luxurious - a great place for independent travellers”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pernickety
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, and my boyfriend, after I asked him for some input, went away and found The Moses Fountain. As soon as I saw the website I was in love with the rooms as they looked gorgeous! Sadly, because I dallied on booking our flights, we couldn't get a reservation for the whole of our trip. I was gutted! James did go away again and find an alternative, but I was so disappointed about missing out on the Moses, we decided to book it for the two nights that were available, and then spend the rest of our trip at Hotel FortySeven (I will be writing a review of that one too)... We arrived by a car that James had arranged to collect us from the airport, and thank goodness as I think we'd have really struggled to find it on our own. (I would definitely recommend this). The Moses Fountain isn't so much a hotel, but more a set of independent rooms within a large townhouse. There is no reception or foyer, for example, but there is a communal terrace area. We were greeted by Andrea, the owner, who had liased with James about our arrival time, so he was around to let us into the building, which is very discreetly marked with a small sign. We were staying in the Turtle Dove room, although we had requested the Indigo one (we were given a choice). Still, it didn't at all matter as the room was stunning. It was very elegant and beautifully styled and we just fell in love with the bathroom with its two sinks, huge mirrors and fantastic shower. Our only complaints would be the steps, the small balcony and the noise. The steps from the outside up to the main 'hotel' building were quite steep and plentiful, which is not ideal with luggage, but thankfully, Andrea helped us on the way in, and my lovely boyfriend carried everything on the way out! The balcony we had (which is used as a selling point on their website) wasn't actually functional as it overlooked another building and was too small for any furniture. In the mornings we were woken up very early by sirens and loud traffic. We're used to this kind of mayhem where we live, so it certainly wouldn't put us off staying here again, but if we were coming for a more relaxing break, it wouldn't have been great. On both of our mornings in the hotel we had breakfast served in our room. The housemaid brought in what we asked for on a tray with a stand and we enjoyed our breakfast in bed, which was a really lovely little luxury! The breakfast selection was somewhat limited for my personal requirements (I require a wheat-free diet as much as possible), but in all fairness to the hotel, the breakfast was exactly as was advertised on the website - there was croissants, toast, bread, muesli, yoghurt and melon. To drink we had fresh orange juice and tea or coffee. Personally, a choice of eggs and a wider choice of fruit would complete breakfast for me, but this minor point would certainly not put me off staying there again! In terms of location, this was ideal for the first part of our trip as on our first day, we walked just five minutes to get a bus tour to get a feel for the city and the sights that we might want to go back and see properly. However, I agree with the other reviews that say that on the whole the area was a little seedy, and I didn't feel as safe at night when walking back as I did when walking back to our second hotel. This again wouldn't put me off staying here a second time, but we would probably go to other areas of town to have dinner and drinks. We had a fantastic stay at this hotel and it was the perfect welcome to Rome for us.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and classy getaway in Rome”
Reviews.Author: saucyt
Reviews.Content: We loved this place much more than other places we stayed in Rome. It is truly a B&B not a hotel, but that is what we wanted. We were in the green room which was very tastefully decorated, and the air conditioning was a relief after walking around in the heat of Rome. The bathroom is very large for European standards and everything was very clean. Our view was of the Agriculture & Forestry building down the road, with orange and palm trees. The street is a little noisy, but that did not bother us in the room. The mini bar is complimentary -- drinks, snacks and a lovely fruit basket awaited us when we arrived. The owner was very nice and helpful. He manages several properties so be sure to let him know when you plan to check out so he will be there. There is a corkscrew in the room should you want to enjoy a bottle of wine. The breakfast was great - nice cappuccinos and an assortment of pastries, fruit, and yogurt. You can enjoy the patio/terrace, or have it in your room. The location is actually easy to get to, but you have to know where to look. Less than 10 min walk from Termini station. It is on Via XX Settembre right across from the church (which you should also visit). Go stand at the church steps then look across the street, you will find it, just to the left a little! We walked to the Trevi fountain in 10-15 minutes. It was nice to be away from the bustle of the tourist area. Absolutely no question we would go back here if we are ever back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and class near the Spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: HooferNewYork
Reviews.Content: Firstly, "hotel" is a bit of a misnomer as this is actually a set of six apartments that do not have that much of a hotel feel to them (there is no front desk, and unlike hotels the contents of the mini bar are included with the price -- very nice!). But they are really cool and elegant apartments -- roomy, with fabulous showers (some even have steam), and all the amenities of a hotel to boot. One mild downside is you have to pretty much know when you are arriving and commit to it and stick to it -- not that modest deviations can't be accommodated, but it makes it much easier if you are at least relatively close to being on time, as you need an "orientation" to how the place works. If you are really freewheeling it and cannot pin down within at least morning or afternoon as to when you will want to "check in," this may not be the best option for you. But don't be deterred as rewards of staying here are ample. There is a bit of construction going on right now on the MOses fountain itself and unfortunately you can't see that sight, but I didn't find it very distracting or off-putting. A real plus is the view of the church across the street which you definitely must enter, as it contains several masterpiece sculptures by the great Bernini, including the Ectasy of Saint Therese. Don't miss it. I said "near the Spanish steps," it is perhaps a 10-15 minute walk but better than staying right there where it is extremely touristy. It is also a short walk from the train station which is another advantage. If you are into high end shopping all of those places are nearby as well. Villa Borghese is also in walking distance (reserve tickets to the classical museum if you want to see it). The modern art gallery is worth a visit and it too is not that far away. I predict that in short order the reputation of this place will soar to the point where it is impossible to book it -- so go now while you can!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - pure class and elegance in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hooorah
Reviews.Content: OK - quick point to note - this is not a hotel as you would think a hotel should be. There is no reception and so make sure that you communicate to the owners what time you will arrive and try and stick to it. Basically, we arrived (very difficult to find and not many people have heard of it - just ask for the Moses Fountain - it is right at the end of Via 20 September) to be greeted by the owner Emanuella who is absolutely lovely. The hotel has about 6 rooms only and each one has been designed differently by Emanuella's brother (architect) and one of his colleagues who is a specialist interior designer. The key to this hotel are the rooms - they are breathtaking. My wife and I stayed in the Red Room - the highlight of which (apart from the comfortable bed and amazing balcony) was the walk in shower/spa. The hotel has a great terrace where guests have breakfast in the morning (served by Laura) overlooking the streets of Rome. My wife and I also had a few glasses of Champagne out there in the evening before heading out to dinner as this was the last stop on our Honeymoon trip to Italy. Location is excellent - Heather and I just walked around - everything can be reached by foot but you might want to take the metro/bus/taxi if you get tired or if it is too hot. There was a lovely Spanish couple that turned up to check in late one evening when Heather and I were on the terrace. Luckily we were there so we could call Emanuella's brother (on call 24 hours) who came to check them in. Another reminder to make sure you stay in contact with the owners and stick to your times. Not sure what they would have done if we were not on the terrace. There is parking very near by for those traveling by car. In summary - this really was a lovely way to end our honeymoon trip. The hotel is classy, elegant and beautiful. It is not the cheapest place but that is not what we were looking for. The lack of reception may be an issue for some people but Heather and I are very independent so this did not bother us at all. Last bit of advice, the quality of the rooms might be a bit of a distraction - make sure you get out and see at least a bit of Rome !!!

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here - just fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BenjiB81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moses Fountain for 2 nights on a trip where I surprised my now financee and proposed at the Trevi Fountain. We found the hotel no problem, just buzz on the big wodden doors and walk up the stairs to the terrace. We had a most warming welcome by the owners, where they gave us a drink and went out of their way to sit down with us to mark recommendations and suggested itinaries on a map they gave us. We stayed in the Swanky Cardinal room (red room) which had a lovely balcony overlooking a church (which was featured in Angels and Demons) and the best shower I have ever experienced (steps down into it with a rainfall shower head). The room was brilliant and had sky tv, a safe and mini bar - aircon was very good and the bed was awesome. A lovely continental breakfast is either served to your room or you can have it on the terrace, there is no bar or restaurant at the hotel but you don't need it because you'll eat out in Rome. I have recommended the Moses Fountain to all my friends and family, this place is a must stay. Book online through the hotel's website and you'll get a 15% discount for paying in advance, we paid €293 for 2 nights in a superior room - which is unbelievble value compared to some places in the UK. It is a 15 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, 5 mins to the nearest Metro (Repubblica) and about 10 mins to Termini. We had a fantastic stay and will definitely be coming back! Ben and Joanna

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: frencis2002
Reviews.Content: First time out of Asia, Moses Fountain is unlike any other hotel I'ved stayed, seen in Asia. No reception, you enter in closed gate, climbed up several stairs up to your room. You'll forget the stairs once you reach your room, it is as you see in the internet. Just perfect. Andrea was very helpful in trying to arrange a guide for me, May is also wonderful in giving me advise and tips specially which bus to take and Emmanuel is so sweet and really makes you feel at home and relax as you seat and talk with her. They actually make up the big plus in Rome, sooooo hot!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful room and the staff were so helpful”
Reviews.Author: majestictrip
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome. We decided a location near the main rail station but also near the centre was needed. We found Moses Fountain through trip advisor just as we have for other locations. In spite of recent bad press on these type of sites, we still have confidence and a bit of common sense tends to weed out those whom you may not feel 100% about. This hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the main rail station but it is the 5 minutes towards all the major parts you will no doubt be visiting during your stay. The staff were wonderful and were so helpful. We were offered to call if we had any queries whilst wondering around. In regards to the accomodation most of it has been said. We were delighted with our room (see photos). We really appreciated the free minibar. This was a nice surprise and we felt it was a nice touch to offer to guests. The free internet access was also helpful. Like previously mentioned if you dont like climbing steps you will probably miss out on this gem as there is no lift. That a shame as this is a gem and we would highly recommend this to friends and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming jewel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: VillaL
Reviews.Content: Your private hideaway in a big city. Perfect location 3 min walk from metro La Repubblica. Corner of St.Susana & 20 Semptiembre . The brown wood door sing above door Moses Fountain , is across the street of the main entrance of Church Santa Maria de la Vittoria. Breakfast continental serve in the patio or your room. We had a superior room very big for Rome or Europeans standards spacious & a huge bathroom with sauna, expresso machine, fridge with water , snacks , soda (coke , orange fanta )included in the room price. Everything in walking distance if you like to walk 15 min to Trevi fountain, Spanish steps . 25 min to the Forum & Colosseum. We took a taxi to Vatican for 7 Euros. There is a Galleria & coffee place write across The Regis hotel which is located at the corner of 20 Septiembre where ther is a taxi stand . Making everything accessible to the city . Also in the plaza la Republica you can find coffee stands , McDonalds & a bus stop for Hop on & off sight seeing bus tour(open bus) for 19Euros 24 hrs making everithing accesible. The only drawback of the hotel is, there are about 30 to 40 steps to enter the hotel from the main entrance. No elevators..they do help you with the luggage. Not recommended for people unable to climb stairs.

Reviews.Title: “"A slice of heaven"”
Reviews.Author: FallonFormica
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent 4 nights at the Moses Fountain Rome and I only have the very best things to say. The rooms and beautiful and clean, new and great lighting. We had a balcony room that looked over the church across the road and a shower that was titled floor to ceiling! Each morning we were treated to breakfast in their courtyard and nothing was too much trouble, toast, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, meats and cheese washed down with hot coffee! The owners went out of their way to show us where to shop, eat and drink! If you are looking to stay in Rome and be 10minutes walk from everything including the train station, dont look past this beautiful hotel- I will be sending all of our friends! Thank you so much for a beautiful 4 nights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: Davyboy69
Reviews.Content: i can't really say anymore than what has already been said in the other reviews. The rooms were very clean and secure. It's a slow 5 minute walk to a hop-on hop-off bus stop and the metro. The central train station is only a 10 minute walk away. Andrea (the owner) arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport (highly recommended) as we were arriving late in the evening and the last thing we wanted to do was search for a hotel in an unknown city with all our bags. May, the housekeeper's name, was great. she'll keep making cappuccinos for you when eating on the terrace. We loved our breakfasts as they were like those we have at home. Our room had a balcony facing a church (the second church seen in the movie Angels & Demons). Andrea spoke english and was a wealth of information especially when it comes to nearby restaurants. My wife and I are picky when it comes to safety and cleanliness in hotels. It's a blessing (or curse) of having a mother-in-law who is a head housekeeper at a national hotel. Everything would pass her scrutinizing eyes. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Your own (really nice) apartment in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michaelep
Reviews.Content: The Moses Fountain Hotel is sort of hard to find. It doesn't have a lobby, and the entrance is through an otherwise nondescript stucco wall, across the street from the Minstero del Agricultura (tell your cab driver - it's the easiest way to find it). It's very close to the Train Station (but out of sight) and there are other fine hotels in the vicinity. There is no elevator - this is not a handicapped friendly edifice - but if you can climb a few flights of nicely aged stairs, you'll find yourself in a clean, very fresh and new home/apartment/hotel conversion. There is no front desk. There are only rooms, and not many of them. Each one looks beautiful, though - very modern, very clean, very spacious - especially for Rome. The location does not put you directly in the historical downtown area, but it's not a long walk. And the area it's in seems to be more lively with an actual Roman crowd, as opposed to a tourist mass - which I thought was nice. It's very quiet in the rooms, outfitted with powerful air conditioners, and the most recent bathroom fixtures, plus modern/contemporary artistic light fixtures. The rooms have safes and minibars, the contents of which are, nicely, free. (The contents are not as extensive as what you'll find in a pay mini-bar, so bring your own booze if you must have some, but it's still a nice touch). There is a lovely outdoor sitting area with tables and chairs on a mid-level terrace, surrounded by jasmine blossoms, so it smells great. There are several superior touches, as well. The soaps they provide are excellent, and I had a free upgrade (not sure why!) to a room that had an enormous, fully tiled circular shower/steambath with a sliver of a window bringing in light from high over the street. I also stayed at a hotel right on the Piazza Rotundo (right on top of the pantheon) and that sort of location is unbelievable, to be sure. The accommodations, though, were far superior at The Moses Fountain, and the Moses Fountain was much less expensive. They're brand new, eager to please, and definitely worth a stay. Give 'em a shot if you want a different sort of hotel experience. One where it's more like your own apartment in Rome, with daily cleaning service :) Oh, and wireless internet was free. A huge deal for me, given the prices some places charge! -Michael

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: PickyGATraveler
Reviews.Content: After a long trip over France and Italy, our last stop was Rome and the Moses Fountain. We definitely saved the best for last. It is brand new, completely modern and very comfortable. We loved the bathroom most of all! Breakfast was very good and the owners and staff were extremely friendly and made us feel welcomed and relaxed. The location is very good. It is at the corner of Via Settembre and Santa Susanna, right next to the St. Regis. We were able to buy hop on-hopoff bus tickets to get around, and it was also very close to the metro. They could easily charge double what we paid for the night. If it happens to be booked check with their other property Hotel Richmond, I bet the quality is just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Veensma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 1 week, thanks to Andrea and Emanuela this was unforgettable. The rooms are very nice, modern, clean and cozy. We slept very well on the good beds. The bathroom is also very nice. We got every morning a very good breakfast in the room. The location is near the subway and trainstation.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: Shazzeroo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at Moses Fountain and thoroughly enjoyed our trip. Nothing was too much trouble for Andrea and Emanuella who were most helpful, kind and courteous. Our room was beautifully decorated, had plenty of space and a comfortable bed. Breakfast was served to our room every day which was marvellous. The location of Moses Fountain is perfect as it is convenient to the station for travelling from and to the airport and very handy for all the sites - we walked everywhere. Some great restaurants in the nearby Via Flavia by the way. I would definitely return to this hotel and would whole heartedly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An amzing boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Uriely
Reviews.Content: The mosses fountain hotel is the best place if you are looking for a romantic holiday. We celebrated our anniversary there last weekend and it was like a second honeymoon. Andrea and Emanuelea, the owners of the hotel decorated our room with red heart shape rose and with a basket of fresh strawberries and blueberries. The room design in beautiful and have a very trendy chick style and yet, felt very warm and cozy. The warm hospitality and help made our first visit in Rome to a great experience. The hotel was in a walking distance from all the important monuments and galleries in town. There were small cafe's and Italian restaurants near by with great food. Next time I'll be in Rome I will defiantly stay here again, next time I will brings the kids as well.

HotelInfo.Name: Moses Fountain Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via 20 Settembre 98 L, 187 Rome, Italy
